Texto: 
spino-cerebellar ataxia
age 50: ataxia onset 

age 57: inherited neurodegenerative disease

first walking aid at age 60, bedridden at age 76.

age 61: diagnosis: opca ii (=adca ii =sca-7)

last 6 month feeding dependent. no obvious cognitive decline 

6 years before her death: no maculopathy 

after cataract extr: vod 0.25, vos: 0.6 

age 77: deceased  
duration disease: 27 years

age 71: genetic diagnosis: sca7
39 cag repeats 
family history: p, pp.
autopsy pm delay: appr 13 hrs.

- neurodegeneration  areas cerebral cortex
- widespread nerve cell loss cerebellum, thalamus, basal ganglia and brain stem.
- ataxin+ ni: cerebellum, cortex, and brainstem, respective of neurodegeneration
